evals.prompt: I need to debug the sigmoid example in examples/activation/sigmoid.py. Can you add debugging code so I can attach GDB?
evals.expected_output: A modified sigmoid.py file with import os, PID printing, and input() for GDB attachment, placed before kernel execution

assertions.name: has_pid_print
assertions.description: File contains PID printing code with os.getpid()

assertions.name: has_input_wait
assertions.description: File contains input() call for waiting

assertions.name: debug_before_execution
assertions.description: Debug code is placed before kernel execution (before test loop)

evals.prompt: Help me debug this TileLang operator. I want to use GDB to step through the C++ code. The file is examples/activation/relu.py
evals.expected_output: A debug version of relu.py with proper debug code insertion

evals.prompt: Create a debug version of examples/gemm/matmul_example.py so I can attach a debugger in VSCode
evals.expected_output: A new matmul_example_debug.py file with GDB debug code added
